references: R. P. Stanley, Enumerative Combinatorics, Cambridge, Vol. 1, 1997; See Exercise 1.41(d).
links: Kwang-Wu Chen, An Interesting Lemma for Regular C-fractions, J. Integer Seqs., Vol. 6, 2003.
formula: Let b(n) be a(n) shifted one place to the left with b(2+4k)=-a(3+4k), k=0, 1, .. Then b(n) is the expansion of sech(x)^2. - Mario Catalani (mario.catalani(AT)unito.it), Feb 08 2003g(x)=x+x^2-2*x^4+16*x^6-272*x^8+... satisfies g(x/(1+2x))=-g(-x).E.g.f.: 1+tan(x).E.g.f. exp(x)*sech(x) is 1,1,0,-2,0,16,0,-272,... (A155585) - _Paul Barry_, Mar 15 2006a(n)= 2^n*abs(Euler(n,0)) where Euler(n,x) is the n-th Eulerian polynomial. - _Robert FERREOL_, Dec 30 2006E.g.f. -log(cos(x)), for n>0. [From _Vladimir Kruchinin_, Aug 09 2010]a(n) = sum_{k=1..n}sum_{j=0..k}(-1)^(floor(n/2)+j+1)*binomial(n+1,k-j)*j^n for n>0. - _Peter Luschny_, Jul 23 2012G.f.: 1 + x/T(0) where T(k)=  1 - (k+1)*(k+2)*x^2/T(k+1); (continued fraction, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 25 2012E.g.f.: 1 + tan(x)=1+x/(U(0)-x) where U(k)= 4*k+1 + x/(1+x/(4*k+3 - x/(1- x/U(k+1)))); (continued fraction, 4-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 08 2012E.g.f.: 1+tan(x)= 1 - 3*x/((U(0) + 3*x^2) where U(k)=  64*k^3 + 48*k^2 - 4*k*(2*x^2+1) - 2*x^2 - 3 - x^4*(4*k-1)*(4*k+7)/U(k+1); (continued fraction, 1-step). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Nov 08 2012E.g.f.: 1+x*G(0) where G(k)=  1 - x^2/(x^2-(2*k+1)*(2*k+3)/G(k+1) ); (recursively defined continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 10 2012G.f.: 1 + x/G(0) where G(k) = 1 - 2*x^2*(4*k^2+4*k+1)-4*x^4*(k+1)^2*(4*k^2+8*k+3)/G(k+1); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Jan 14 2013.a(n) ~ 2*n!*(2/Pi)^(n+1) if n is odd. - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Jun 01 2013G.f.: 1 + x*Q(0), where Q(k) = 1 - x^2*(k+1)*(k+2)/( x^2*(k+1)*(k+2) - 1/Q(k+1) ); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 10 2013G.f.: Q(0), where Q(k) = 1 + x*(k+1)/( x*(k+1) + 1/(1 - x*(k+1)/( x*(k+1) - 1/Q(k+1) ))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Oct 22 2013E.g.f.: 2 - 1/Q(0), where Q(k) = 1 + x/( 4*k+1 - x/(1 - x/( 4*k+3 + x/Q(k+1) ))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, Dec 20 2013
maple: u:=proc(n) if n=0 then 1 else -add(u(k)*binomial(n,k)/2*2^(n-k),k=0..n-1) fi end;seq(u(n),n=0..15); - _Robert FERREOL_, Dec 30 2006
mathematica: a[m_] := Abs[Sum[(-2)^(m-k) k! StirlingS2[m,k], {k,0,m}]]; Table[a[i], {i,0,20}] (* _Peter Luschny_, Apr 29 2009 *)
prog: (PARI) a(n)=if(n<1,n==0,n!*polcoeff(tan(x+x*O(x^n)),n))(Sage)def A009006(n) :    if n == 0 : return 1    return add(add((-1)^(n//2+j+1)*binomial(n+1,k-j)*j^n for j in (0..k)) for k in (1..n))[A009006(n) for n in (0..26)] # _Peter Luschny_, Jul 23 2012
author: _R. H. Hardin_
